org.dyn4j.geometry

Class AbstractShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.geometry.AbstractShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shape, Transformable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Capsule, Circle, Ellipse, HalfEllipse, Slice, Wound

    public abstract class AbstractShape
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shape, Transformable
    Base implementation of the Shape interface.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    3.1.4
    Author:
    William Bittle

      • rotateAboutCenter

        public void rotateAboutCenter(double theta)
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Rotates the Shape about it's center.

        This method replaced the overriding functionality of the rotate method from the Transformable interface.

        Specified by:
        rotateAboutCenter in interface Shape

      • project

        public Interval project(Vector2 n)
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Returns the Interval of this Shape projected onto the given Vector2 given the Transform.

        This is the same as calling Shape.project(Vector2, Transform) and passing Transform.IDENTITY.

        Specified by:
        project in interface Shape
        Parameters:
        n - Vector2 to project onto
        Returns:
        Interval

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Vector2 point)
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Returns true if the given point is inside this Shape.

        If the given point lies on an edge the point is considered to be inside the Shape.

        The given point is assumed to be in world space.

        This is the same as calling Shape.contains(Vector2, Transform) and passing Transform.IDENTITY.

        Specified by:
        contains in interface Shape
        Parameters:
        point - world space point
        Returns:
        boolean

      • createAABB

        public AABB createAABB()
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Creates an AABB from this Shape.

        This is the same as calling Shape.createAABB(Transform) and passing Transform.IDENTITY.

        Specified by:
        createAABB in interface Shape
        Returns:
        AABB the AABB enclosing this Shape
